Description: Granite scarab of Ramses II: inscribed on one side with the names of Ramses II and epithets. The other sides are now rough and show signs of deliberate erasure. The monument is badly worn in many places. The corners are damaged, and there are many gouges on the surface.
Curator's comments: It is difficult to determine whether the surviving inscription was recut on a repolished surface as this surface is not deeply indented. However, this seems more likely than a subsequent erasure of part of the inscription of Ramses II. Bibliography: The British Museum, 'Please Touch Animal Sculpture' (London, 1983). no. 13; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' VIII (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 1171 Minas-Nerpel, Der Gott Chepri (OLA 154, 2006), 353-354, note 982. Bierbrier, Hieroglyfic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, Part 12, London 1993, 8, pl.12-13
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1993 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 12. (Pl.12-13)
Condition: The monument is badly worn in many places. The corners are damaged, and there are many gouges on the surface.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
